question: A new building needed 12 windows. The builder had already installed 6 of them. If it takes 4 hours to install each window, how long will it take him to install the rest?
response:
The builder has already installed 6 windows, which means he has installed 12 - 6 = <<12-6=6>>6 windows.
It takes 4 hours to install each window, so the total time to install all 12 windows would be 12 windows x 4 hours per window = <<12*4=48>>48 hours.
Since the builder has already installed 6 windows, he has 12 - 6 = <<12-6=6>>6 windows left to install.
The time it will take him to install the rest of the windows is 6 windows x 4 hours per window = <<6*4=24>>24 hours.
The answer is 48 hours - 24 hours = <<48-24=24>>24 hours.
